column1: Glorfindel is rarely portrayed like in the book. His role in The Lord of the Rings is too small to be introduced and forgotten - he basically does little else beyond providing fast transport to Rivendell. In the more popular works
column2: his role has been filled by another Elf.

column1: 1978: The Lord of the Rings (1978 film):
:In this adaptation
column2: the role of Glorfindel was taken by Legolas. In a simplification of that character
column3: and as a reason for his coming
column4: he is portrayed as an Elf of Rivendell rather than Mirkwood.

column1: 1981: The Lord of the Rings (1981 radio series):
:Glorfindel appears in his original role at the Last Bridge
column2: voiced by John Webb. Because the part of Gildor was cut
column3: the heavily wounded Frodo says the Quenya greeting Elen síla lúmenn omientielvo to him
column4: and Glorfindel replies with Gildors answer. Glorfindel keeps his two Sindarin lines
column9: though he says them with a heavy English accent. Glorfindels role at the Council of Elrond is omitted.  His name is pronounced correctly in the adaptation

column1: 1988: J.R.R. Tolkiens War in Middle Earth:
:Glorfindel is a powerful playable character once the One Ring passes the Last Bridge
column2: who leads the Fellowship to Rivendell.

column1: 2001: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring:
:To limit the already large number of one-appearance characters
column2: Glorfindel has been omitted in this adaptation as well. Peter Jackson decided to have Arwen meet the travellers and then ride on Asfaloth.

column1: 2002: The Lord of the Rings: The Fellowship of the Ring (video game):
:Glorfindel appears on the Last Bridge. He has several Sindarin lines: A na vedui
column5: mellon (which Frodo accurately translates as "Well met
column6: friend"). He comes to the aid of the hobbits at the request of Elrond
column7: who had received news from Gildor - even though there is no mention of that group earlier in the gameplay. Glorfindel does so in a monotonous voice
column8: and his speech continues without pause. He also uses the lines Noro lim
column10: though he does not say them to his horse: he says them to Frodo. No actor is specified for this part.

column1: 2003: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King:
:Decipher made two The Lord of the Rings Trading Card Game featuring extra Jarl Benzon as Glorfindel
column2: one of them being at the Coronation of Elessar.  He is briefly seen in the film at Aragorns coronation when Arwen is revealed.

column1: 2006: The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II:
:Glorfindel played an important part in this video game
column2: set during the War of the Ring. Together with Glóin of Lonely Mountain
column3: Glorfindel fights in several places in northern Eriador and Rhovanion. He is voiced by Jason Carter
column4: and portrayed as white haired. His design was changed to a more movie-accurate version in the expansion pack
column5: The Lord of the Rings: The Battle for Middle-earth II: The Rise of the Witch-king. He serves as narrator throughout
column6: and appears in the story itself after the death of Arvedui.

column1: 2007: The Lord of the Rings Online:

:Glorfindel can be found in Rivendell just south of the Rivendell. He has long blond hair and wears a white robe with purple belt. He is involved in some of the book quests for Shadows of Angmar. The player also talks to him after defeating the balrog Thaurlach.
2012: Lego The Lord of the Rings: The Video Game:

:Glorfindel is purchasable as an optional player character in DLC character pack 2 for use in free play and on the open world. He is portrayed with light tan hair (rather than yellow blond like Legolas)
column2: wears an outfit which is a mix of light blue robe parts and silver armour whilst wearing a light blue cape. He wields a bow of the Galadhrim and also carries a golden Elvish longsword (all Elvish longswords appear gold in the game). Glorfindel is one of the most proficient fighter characters in the game.
